page.title: 16WILDLIFE UNDER THREAT
page.content: BROUGHT UNDER CONTROL.THE MAIN CAUSES ARE THOUGHT TO BE:- a)NUTRIENT LEACHING FROM FARMLAND b)TURBULENCE FROM BOAT WAKES STIRRING UP BOTTOM SILT c)DROPPINGS FROM CORMORANT AND GULL ROOSTS LEGISLATION AND LOCAL BY-LAWS SEEK TO CONTROL a AND b,BUT THE PROBLEM IS LACK OF ENFORCEMENT.THE NUMBERS OF ROOSTING BIRDS IS INCREASING ANNUALLY, AND THE RESULTANT EUTROPHICATION OF FAVOURED BROADS IS THOUGHT TO BE A MAJOR CAUSE OF BLOOMS OF TOXIC ALGAE LIKE PRYMNESIUM,WHICH PERIODICALLY KILL THE ENTIRE FISH POPULATION OF SEVERAL BROADS AND RIVERS. THE LOCAL CONSENSUS IS THAT TOURISM AND AGRICULTURE ARE ESSENTIAL FACTORS IN THE ECONOMY OF THE AREA,BUT THAT MORE STRINGENT CONTROLS OVER THE EXPANSION OF EITHER ARE NECESSARY.
